intro: Nassauvia revoluta var. nivalis, commonly known as the alpine nassauvia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh alpine environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
